intro: Digitalis minor, commonly known as the Lesser Foxglove, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its tubular, violet to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Due to its toxic properties, it should be handled with care.
